Mexico is currently in trade negotiation: which may involve Mexico importing grains from Argentina.
No finalized deal has been made: and the negotiations are primarily driven by the uncertainty caused by Donald Trump's vow to renegotiate the North American Free Trade Agreement (NAFTA), not his border wall plan.
Donald Trump: s campaign pledges included building a border wall and renegotiating NAFTA, which he criticized as the worst trade deal approved in the US.
As of November 2017: Mexico and Argentina have not signed an agreement like the one described in the claim, although talks about a more limited trade deal involving grains and cars have taken place. The main catalyst for these negotiations is the uncertainty caused by Trump's vow to renegotiate NAFTA.
